titlepage.titleproper: Register of the African subject collection, 1831-2007
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 40 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 3 phonorecords, 1 phonotape cassette, 6 videotape cassettes

did.abstract: Electronic and other bulletins, pamphlets, leaflets, clippings, serial issues, reports, communiqués, press releases, maps, and other printed matter, relating to various aspects of twentieth-century African history; political, social and economic conditions in Africa as a whole; revolutionary movements in Africa; international support groups for such movements; droughts and famines in the Sahel region and elsewhere; and the AIDS epidemic in Africa.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], African Subject Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives. An increment was added in 2011.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Electronic and other bulletins, pamphlets, leaflets, clippings, serial issues, reports, communiqués, press releases, maps, and other printed matter, relating to various aspects of twentieth-century African history; political, social and economic conditions in Africa as a whole; revolutionary movements in Africa; international support groups for such movements; droughts and famines in the Sahel region and elsewhere; and the AIDS epidemic in Africa.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Droughts--Africa.
Guerrillas--Africa.
AIDS (Disease)--Africa.

scopecontent.p: Electronic and other bulletins, pamphlets, leaflets, clippings, serial issues, reports, press releases, maps, and other printed matter, relating to various aspects of twentieth-century African history; political, social and economic conditions in Africa as a whole; revolutionary movements in Africa; international support groups for such movements; droughts and famines in the Sahel region and elsewhere; and the AIDS epidemic in Africa.
Announcements, articles, clippings, pamphlets, press releases and reports relating to drought conditions throughout Africa
Articles, bulletins, clippings, communiques, newsletters, statements and reports relating to revolutionary movements in Africa
Brochures, clippings, leaflets, pamphlets and printed matter relating to various aspects of life in Africa
French Revolution Bicentennial postcards and posters

did.container: Tape cabinet, Record cabinet, Cassette cabinet

scopecontent.p: 6 videocassette tapes, 3 phonorecords and 1 phonotape cassette relating to African culture

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: See card catalog for increments that may have been received after February 1995

Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS)
Group of African, Carribean and Pacific States - Relations with the European Economic Community

General. Includes materials on southern Africa, primarily Namibia, Angola and Guinea-Bissau; and Portugal
Africa Fund. Includes materials on countries of southern Africa and divestment
Committee to Oppose Bank Loans to South Africa (COBLSA)
Reports. Includes materials on Africa in general
United States Congress. Congressional testimonies. Includes material on United States- Portuguese relations in Africa
General. Includes newsletters, memoranda and flyers relating to southern Africa
Committee to Oppose Bank Loans to South Africa (COBLSA). See American Committee on Africa
News clippings packages. Includes materials on southern Africa
Australian Center for International Agricultural Research
British Defence and Aid Fund for Southern Africa
Campaign to Stop the War against Angola and Mozambique (SWAM)
Center for the Study of Power and Peace
Committee for Academic Freedom in Africa
Coordinating Committee for International Voluntary Services (CCIVS)
D.C. Coalition Against Apartheid and Racism
Deutsches Komitee fur Angola, Guinea-Bissua und Mocambique
International Society for Individual Liberty, Inc.
National Coalition to Support African Liberation
Saint Charles Lwanga African Academy, Inc.
Secretariat of the International Union of Students
Toronto Committee for the Liberation of Southern Africa
Permanent missions to the United Nations
Comite Permanent Interetats de Lutte Contre la Secheresse dans le Sahel (CILSS)

Announcement of monetary gifts to the League
United States. Agency for International Development (USAID)
General. Directories of African revolutionary movements and international support groups
Canary Islands. Mouvement pour l'Autodetermination et l'Independance de l'Archipel Canarien (MPAIAC)
Cape Verde. Partido Africano da Independencia de Cabo Verde (PAICV)
Comoro Islands. Mouvement de Liberation Nationale des Comores (MOLINACO)
Committee for Freedom in Mozambique, Angola and Guinea-Bissau
Reunion. French Revolution Bicentennial postcards and posters (in French)
Live Aid Concert. Fund raising for African famine relief, n.d. Four tapes, VHS
Sport Aid. UNICEF. Promotional package, 1986. One tape, VHS
Sport Aid. UNICEF. TV special, parts 1-3, 1986. One tape, VHS
Phonotape cassette. "Chaque Homme Est Mon Frere," Buhendwa Nachiko, 1986

scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described.
